ä¼šå¯¹è¾“å…¥å¸¦æ¥ä»€ä¹ˆå½±å“ã€‚åœ¨æ–‡ç« çš„åé¢å†…å®¹ä¼šæœ‰å…³äºå­—ç¬¦è¯»å…¥çš„æ›´è¯¦ç»†çš„ä¾‹å­ã€‚ å¼•å…¥ç¼“å†²åŒºçš„åŸç†ï¼Œå½“ç„¶æ˜¯è¦æœåŠ¡è¾“å…¥è¾“å‡ºå‡½æ•°çš„ï¼Œscanfå’Œprintfæ˜¯æ­é…ä½¿ç”¨çš„å‡½æ•°ï¼Œä»–ä»¬ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ³•åŸºæœ¬ä¸€è‡´ï¼Œåªæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªè´Ÿè´£è¾“å…¥ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªè´Ÿè´£è¾“å‡ºã€‚ è§£è¯»scanf( ) scanf("%d %d",&n,&m); ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°æ ¼å¼åŒ–è¾“å…¥æ§åˆ¶å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼ˆCè¯­è¨€ä¸­åŒå¼•å·ä¸­çš„å†…å®¹è¡¨ç¤ºå­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼‰å³â€œ%d %dâ€ï¼Œåœ¨printfè¿™ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦ä¸²ç”¨æ¥è§„å®šæ‰“å°åœ¨å±å¹•ä¸Šå†…å®¹çš„æ ¼å¼ï¼Œå¯¹å…¶åŠ ç©ºæ ¼ï¼Œè®©å˜é‡ä»¥ä½•ç§å½¢å¼å±•ç°ç­‰ç­‰ï¼Œscanfä¸­ä¹Ÿä¸€æ ·ï¼Œè§„å®šæˆ‘ä»¬è¦ä»¥ä½•ç§æ–¹å¼æ¥è¾“å…¥ã€‚ åé¢çš„å˜é‡æ˜¯ä¸ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°ï¼ˆå­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼‰ç›¸å¯¹åº”çš„æ¥æ”¶è¾“å…¥æ•°æ®çš„å˜é‡åœ°å€åˆ—è¡¨ã€‚ï¼ˆåœ°å€è¿™ä¸ªæ¦‚å¿µè¿™é‡Œå…ˆä¸å¤šåšèµ˜è¿°ï¼Œè¿™ä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆscanfå˜é‡è¦åŠ ä¸Š&çš„åŸå› ï¼Œå…ˆç†è§£ä¸ºå˜é‡æŒ‰é¡ºåºåŒ¹é…å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ä¸­çš„%å°±è¡Œï¼‰ è¯´å¤šæ¦‚å¿µæ— ç›Šï¼Œç›´æ¥ä¸Šä»£ç #include <stdio.h>int main() { int a, b, c; scanf("%d %d", &a, &b); printf("a+b=%d
", a+b); scanf("%d %d", &a, &b); printf("a+b=%d
", a+b); scanf("%d, %d, %d", &a, &b, &c); printf("a+b+c=%d
", a+b+c); scanf("%d is bigger than %d", &a, &b); printf("a-b=%d
", a-b); scanf("%d%d", &a, &b); printf("a+b=%d
", a+b); return 0; } è¿è¡Œç»“æœï¼š

item.description: Lab Work 04-1. Application of Stacks Note: Programming in C, Design a C program to implement: (1) Arithmetic expression translation: from in-fix to post-fix notation (2) Evaluation of an arithmetic expression in post-fix notation Solution: #include<stdio.h>#include<string.h>int main(){ char in_fix[20]={0};//ä¸­ç¼€ char post_fix[20]={0};//åå‡† char stack[20]={0};// int top=0; int index=0; scanf("%s",in_fix); /*translation*/ for(int i=0;i<strlen(in_fix);i++){ if(in_fix[i]>='0'&&in_fix[i]<='9'){ post_fix[index++]=in_fix[i]; }else if(in_fix[i]=='('){ stack[top++]='('; }else if(in_fix[i]==')'){ while(stack[top-1]!='('){ post_fix[index++]=stack[top-1]; top--; } }else if(in_fix[i]=='+'||in_fix[i]=='-'){ if(top){ while(stack[top-1]=='*'||stack[top-1]=='/'){ post_fix[index++]=stack[top-1]; top--; } } stack[top++]=in_fix[i]; }else{ stack[top++]=in_fix[i]; } } while(top){ if(stack[top-1]!

item.title: Polynomials of one indeterminate
item.description: Requirements: Note: Programming in C, Let n be a positive integer with specified initial value n=30. Use an array of n units to store polynomials of one indeterminate (ä¸€å…ƒå¤šé¡¹å¼). Design and implement a C program to: Determine the data structure of the array Use a stack S in the array to store unused units. Initially all the units are unused and the 0 to (n-1) indexes spread randomly on the stack Use two lists LP and LQ in the array to store two polynomials P and Q of one indeterminate Show the map of the array Adding P and Q, restore the result as a list LPQ in the array, and release all garbage units to the stack Show the map of the array again Solutionï¼š â€‹ é“¾è¡¨çš„é™æ€å®ç°æ³•ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨æ•°ç»„æ¨¡æ‹ŸåŠ¨æ€é“¾è¡¨ï¼Œç”¨æ ˆæ¥æ ‡è®°è¿˜æœªä½¿ç”¨çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹ã€‚
